author: Patrick Tobler
title: nft-maker.io -> Full NFT platform
description: There's high demand for user-friendly NFT platforms & marketplaces on Cardano.

assessments.note: As NFTs are in extreme high demand, improving on the existing nft-maker.io by developing a marketplace will drive adoption tremendously if properly executed.
Short proposal, but brings it straight to the point.
This is a complete proposal to extend an already existing Cardano product in the nft-maker.

The NFT-maker.io team is one of the first teams out of the gate, they have a working NFT maker product that is currently being utilized. Based on their existing product it appears they have the drive and skills to improve the product and adoption interest in Cardano.
This proposal focuses on a specific service that the author did create and is earning good money on it. It fails to explain how this will improve the dApps ecosystem.
assessments.reply: The proposal is clearly about bringing an existing dApp to the next step. If this isn't improving the dApp ecosystem, I don't know what is.

assessments.note: This is a great tool that will help bring non-techies crypto community to the space, specifically for Cardano. The ability to create NFT with ease is a great idea. Having a market place will also allow NFT creator capability to benefit seamlessly with one stop shop.
This proposal meet fund 5: DApps & Integration and addresses the challenge with a well defined solution.

Challenges is general and not a problem statement. It is a hype related statement.

However goals are being mentioned point by point.

Few of the biggest challenges in NFT marketplace are:

1) Searching ability
2) Fraud and spam content
3) Expensive fees

The only challenge mentioned by the project goals is to address the expensive fees.

Proposer should tackle the other two issue alongside with the other challenges counter with the goal mentioned.
assessments.reply: The assessor picked arbitrary "challenges" that they think are important. It's a very subjective review and feels very unfair.

assessments.note: The team is experienced in the space and has shown that they can execute. An open API or a publicly visible github repository of their existing work would likely improve this rating even more.
nft-maker.io has working product already. Chances are very hight that they deliver the full product.
The proposer has already implemented the nft-maker system and is not requesting funds to build an entire platform around it.

When disruptive and transformational technologies roll out, it's the teams of motivated individuals who progress the effort. Risk takers that take the time to learn and create utility where there was none, start to pave the way for the rest of us. Trust and transparency in NFTs will help drive greater adoption and continued need for this type of service. Anti-piracy, certified guarantee, certified collectibles, memorabilia grading type companies and the list goes on, will be looking to incorporate this type of application into their business model. The NFT market is just budding and Cardano should be the vehicle of choice. The Cardano community needs a win with NFT development and to gain adoption and trust on its blockchain.  This project should receive investment to help enable web portal improvement, usability, trust and overall success with the Cardano ecosystem. Bottom line...they already have a working product.
Proposers already have beta up and running. Nice to see LinkedIn profiles backup up claimed experience.
The proposer already made most of the product, and therefore, provided its experience.

Having a working site that are already functioning is a proof that the proposer is fully capable in executing his plan. The asked amount is a bit on the higher end for a 4 months project, granted there are a lot of man power involved. One risk for this project is the high fee to mint the NFT, it could hinder the adoption rate especially in the beginning when mass adoption is needed to ensure the continuity of the project.

3 of the founder are the expert on their field. 

Proposer is using general timeline based on after 3 months, after 6 months and so on. Proposer did not specific on the timeline.

Manpower, currently 3 founders are doing the project themselves. Fund requested to add more manpower to ensure the timeline is been met. 

On the additional developers, no mention on how many developers will be paid using the requested fund.

Marketing budget is too small, 5,000 to attract crowd and artists.

The technical information is somewhat sparse and it is unclear where traditional technology (why MongoDB?) ends and Cardano starts. Further clarification where you foresee the need for freelance developer(s) would have been helpful, too.
The technical challenges could be described a little bit more in detail, but besides that a clear explanation.
Complete proposal plan from a developer who has already implemented the nft-maker initial product.

Voters should have enough information to feel confident their candidate will succeed. More detailed information on the use of funds would have been nice to ensure there is a solid business plan and attainable goals. For example, voters may be concerned regarding the high allocation of funds for salaries. A start up is a risky endeavor; personal time and effort is paramount, but salary safety and comfort is not necessarily an initial requirement. Full funding effort should be poured into implementation and not necessarily on salary. Product adoption and success will drive future revenue and high salaries. Allocating more funds toward marketing and developer help vs salary could lead to exponential future salary gains. Ramen noodles now, steak and caviar later.  Regarding marketing, the target audience needs to be addressed and tactics to obtain adoption in the product should be a goal.
Seems reasonable to assume this project is feasible given prior work and plan detailed.

Granted the milestones for the next 12 months are listed, it's not clear what would be considered a success as far as how many users signed up including the artists it plans to recruits, as well as how it plans to advertise/promote the site to increase the traffic.

The information provided in the Roadmap is sufficient to track and audit the project progress.
The only question I have is How will this proposal impacts the challenge metrics and benefit the Cardano Community. How do you plan to market this project to attract more users to this platform.

Information provided was not complete and comprehensive. It is not easy to audit based on the full deliverables later.

However, audit can be based on the goals and its timeline.

solution: We want to expand nft-maker.io to a point where it's not only a minting tool but also a **decentralized market place for multi-media NFTs**.
experience: Patrick, Peter & Fahim, a **Developer, SPO** and **two** **Designers**. We've successfully launched one of the biggest NFT sites on Cardano so far.
